## v.1.0. // "We Build. We Donâ€™t Harass."

### Our Pledge
We, the maladjusted minds behind AscendNet, pledge to build this AI-obsessed, code-mutating experiment in a way thatâ€™s free from harassment, dogma, and drama. Regardless of whether youâ€™re bootstrapping from a microwave or pushing PRs from a 96-core bunker, youâ€™re welcome here.

We pledge to interact like semi-functional humans, or at least like socially aware cyborgs. This means no harassment, no discrimination, and no being a jerk.

### Our Standards
Want to contribute? Great. Hereâ€™s the vibe:

## Expected behavior:

Treat others like they're debugging code with a migraine. Go easy.

Respect different views â€” even the totally wrong ones.

Give feedback like youâ€™re not trying to start a war.

Take responsibility when you break things. Apologize. Learn. Update your worldview.

Remember the mission: Build smart systems. Donâ€™t act like a broken one.

## Unacceptable behavior:

Creepy comments. Crude memes. Sexualized anything. Gross.

Trolling. Flame wars. â€œGit blameâ€ culture.

Harassment, public or private.

Doxxing or leaking info without consent.

Turning this into some ideological battleground. Take that to Reddit.

Enforcement Responsibilities
Admins (read: tired but firm code wizards) have the final say. If you're acting like a corrupted node, theyâ€™ll snip your connection and sanitize the logs. They reserve the right to:

Remove or modify any content.

Nuke your access if needed.

Deliver ban-hammer justice â€” gently or violently, depending on vibes.

## Scope
This code applies in all spaces: commits, issues, PRs, Discord, signal fires, dead drops â€” wherever AscendNet exists. If you represent the project publicly, the rules follow you like a tracking cookie.
